sections.title: Make sure java is installed
sections.text:
Open a comand window and type: java -version You should geta response like this: 

java version "1.7.0_45" Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.7.0_45-b18) Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 24.45-b08, mixed mode, sharing)
if you do java is installed properly and you can move on to next section.

If you get an answer like this: 

'java' is not recognized as an in operable program or batch file.
java is not properly installed

Java might still be installed butt not added to the path variable. Open Control Panel\Programsif Java(32-bit) exists ther Java is installd otherwise go to java.com/download/and download and install java.

To add Java to the path variable open Control Panel\Programsand open Java(32-bit) go to tab 'Java' click view and copy the Path column. Open Control Panel\System and Security\Systemand click 'Advanced system Setting' click Enviroment Variables button. In the system variables table find the path variable and add the java path to it. OBS only add the path up to the bin library ex: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre7\bin

sections.title: Make sure NodeJS is installed
sections.text:
Open a comand window and type: node --version You should geta response like this: 

v0.10.22
If you do NodeJS is installed and you can move on to the next section. Otherwise go to nodejs.org and install NodeJS

sections.title: Install Mysis Git
sections.text:
Go to http://msysgit.github.io/ download and instal Git. Open a comand window and type git --version to verify that git has been installed properly. You shoud get a response like this.

git version 1.8.4.msysgit.0

sections.title: Install Source Tree
sections.text: Go to http://www.sourcetreeapp.com/ and download and instal Source Tree.

sections.title: Make sure NodeJS is installed
sections.text:
Open a comand window and type: node --version You should geta response like this: 

v0.10.22
If you do NodeJS is installed and you can move on to the next section. Otherwise go to nodejs.org and install NodeJS

sections.title: Install Karam
sections.text:
Open a comand window, navigate to your testfolder and type 

npm install karma --save-dev
Install tools that we use in Karma 
npm install karma-jasmine karma-chrome-launcher --save-dev
And then install karma kli so we can use Karam command. 
npm install -g karma-cli

sections.title: Adding a new Angular Page
sections.text:
New Files:
  • Create New Module Js File with new Module and controller
  • Create View File
AngularMaster Changes:
  • Add script tag for module file
  • (Add Menu Items to new page)
*.app.js Changes:
  • Add Module to injection list
  • Add route for new page
